# Security Policy

## Supported Versions

This project is developed and maintained on a best-effort basis.

| Version | Status     |
| ------- | ---------- |
| main    | Supported  |

Only the `main` branch is considered supported. Older commits, tags, or forks are **not** supported.

---

## Reporting a Vulnerability

If you believe you have found a security vulnerability in this project, **do not create a public issue or pull request**.

Instead, please report it privately:

- **GitHub Security Advisories:** Use the “Report a vulnerability” feature on the repository (if available).
- **Email:** `security@example.com` (replace with your real email)

When reporting, please include:

- A clear description of the issue
- Steps to reproduce
- Potential impact
- Any proof-of-concept code (if applicable)
- Your environment (OS, versions, etc.)

We aim to:

- Acknowledge your report within **7 days**
- Provide an initial assessment within a reasonable time
- Inform you when the issue is fixed or why it won’t be addressed

---

## Disclosure Policy

- Please **do not** publicly disclose details of the vulnerability until:
  - A fix has been developed and released, **or**
  - We explicitly agree that public disclosure is acceptable.
- Do not exploit the vulnerability beyond what is strictly necessary to demonstrate it.
- Do not access, modify, or destroy any data that does not belong to you.

Unauthorized exploitation, data access, or disruption of service may be treated as abuse and could have legal implications.

---

## Scope

This security policy applies only to:

- The original repository owned by **@perlinleo** on GitHub
- Code and configurations that are part of this repository

It **does not** apply to:

- Third-party dependencies
- Forks or modified versions of this project
- Deployments or environments operated by others

---

## No Bug Bounty

At this time, this project does **not** operate a bug bounty program and does **not** offer financial rewards or compensation for vulnerability reports.

Your help in responsibly disclosing security issues is appreciated, but it is strictly voluntary and uncompensated.

---

## Legal

By reporting a vulnerability, you agree to:

- Comply with this policy
- Avoid violating any applicable laws
- Avoid causing harm, service disruption, or accessing data without authorization

Nothing in this document grants you any rights to use, copy, modify, or distribute the Software.  
All rights remain with the Author under the project’s license.
